result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:59 PM Defendant Matthew G Bergum appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Christopher M. Eippert appeared by phone for Matthew G Bergum.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for State of Wisconsin. State is in compliance w/victim's rights. Defense motion to reduce cash bond to $1,000 with admission to the Zablocki VA Medical Center in Milwaukee for participation in inpatient residential treatment for substance abuse and mental health issues. State objects to bond modification. Court denies defense bond motion.

4:02 PM Prosecuting attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew G Bergum in court, in custody.  Attorney Christopher M. Eippert in court for Matthew G Bergum. Deputy Christopher Lemke S&T  There is stipulation as to identification as to this hearing.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial. State has filed the information. Defense has received the information and waives it's reading. Defendant enters NG pleas. Atty's to work out PTC on their own. Court sets a SC.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Scheduling conference on October 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Petition for appointment of counsel, affidavit of indigency and order.  Atty. Eippert is appointed as counsel.
Defendant is to repay Sheboygan County at the rate of $100 per month until total sum is paid.
The first payment shall be made on 10/01/22.  
Failure to make payment on the schedule as established above shall result in the remaining balance becoming immediately due. Sheboygan County through its Corporation Counsel, may initiate a lawsuit or other collection action against you to collect the amount due, together with costs.
The attorney shall be compensated at $100 per hour, not to exceed a total of $750 without prior approval of Court.
To receive payment, bill must be submitted within 90 days of withdrawal or case disposition

Copy provided to DE in SCDC
Preliminary hearing on August 17, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Atty. Eippert

Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions: 
No contact directly or indirectly with the party/parties named in the bail bond, no contact at their residence/property. 
Not possess any dangerous weapons. 
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages. 
Comply with day reporting requirements; monitor drug abstinence through UA's; GPS monitoring.
